history.proof: intros n p H1 H2. destruct H1 as [H1a H1b]. exists 1. split. + exists p. apply divides_antisym; auto. * shelve. * shelve. + intros contra. apply H2. apply divides_antisym. * shelve. * shelve.

chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof, without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Sovle This Proof State:

Hypotheses:


Goal:
forall n p : nat, is_prime p -> n <> 0 -> {m : nat | divides n (power p m) /\ ~ divides n (power p (m + 1))}

Premises:
power = fix power (x n : nat) {struct n} : nat := match n with | 0 => 1 | S n0 => x * power x n0 end : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments power (_ _)%nat_scope
divides = fun a b : nat => exists q : nat, a = b * q : nat -> nat -> Prop Arguments divides (_ _)%nat_scope
Inductive nat : Set := O : nat | S : nat -> nat Arguments S _%nat_scope
is_prime = fun p : nat => p <> 1 /\ (forall d : nat, divides p d -> d = 1 \/ d = p) : nat -> Prop Arguments is_prime _%nat_scope
divides_nat : forall n : nat, {p : nat | p <> 1 /\ p <> n /\ divides n p} + {forall p : nat, p <> 1 -> p <> n -> ~ divides n p}
prime_power_qn : forall p n q x : nat, is_prime p -> divides (power x n) (power p (q * n)) -> 1 <= n -> divides x (power p q)
prime_power : forall p n x : nat, is_prime p -> divides (power x n) p -> divides x p
divides_prime : forall a : nat, (exists p : nat, p <> a /\ is_prime p /\ divides a p) -> ~ is_prime a
prime_cond : forall p : nat, p <> 1 /\ (forall a : nat, a <> 1 -> a <> p -> ~ divides p a) < -> is_prime p
not_prime_impl_prime_divides : forall n : nat, ~ is_prime n -> {p : nat | is_prime p /\ divides n p} + {n = 1}
prime_div_gcd : forall p a : nat, is_prime p -> ~ divides a p -> rel_prime p a
prime_rel_prime : forall p a : nat, is_prime p -> ~ rel_prime a p -> divides a p
prime_square : forall p a : nat, is_prime p -> divides (square a) p -> divides a p
prime_mult : forall p a b : nat, is_prime p -> divides (a * b) p -> divides a p \/ divides b p
gcd_prime : forall p : nat, p <> 1 -> (forall d a : nat, is_gcd d a p -> d = 1 \/ d = p) -> is_prime p
power_divides_power : forall x n m : nat, x > 1 -> divides (power x n) (power x m) -> m <= n
mult_lt_compat_r : forall n m p : nat, n < m -> 0 < p -> n * p < m * p
prime_gcd : forall d p a : nat, is_prime p -> is_gcd d a p -> d = 1 \/ d = p
power_divides_lemma1 : forall n x : nat, 0 < n -> divides (power x n) x
Nat.mul_le_mono_pos_l : forall n m p : nat, 0 < p -> n <= m < -> p * n <= p * m
Nat.lt_trans : forall n m p : nat, n < m -> m < p -> n < p
Nat.le_lt_trans : forall n m p : nat, n <= m -> m < p -> n < p
power_lt : forall p m : nat, 1 < p -> 0 < m -> 1 < power p m
Nat.mul_sub_distr_r : forall n m p : nat, (n - m) * p = n * p - m * p
power_power_rel_prime : forall a n b m : nat, n > 0 -> m > 0 -> rel_prime (power a n) (power b m) < -> rel_prime a b
mult_le_compat_r : forall n m p : nat, n <= m -> n * p <= m * p
Nat.mul_assoc : forall n m p : nat, n * (m * p) = n * m * p
odd_even_lem : forall p q : nat, 2 * p + 1 <> 2 * q
Nat.add_lt_mono_r : forall n m p : nat, n < m < -> n + p < m + p
fast_Zplus_permute : forall (n m p : Z) (P : Z -> Prop), P (m + (n + p))%Z -> P (n + (m + p))%Z
Fin.of_nat : forall p n : nat, Fin.t n + {exists m : nat, p = n + m}
plus_is_one : forall m n : nat, m + n = 1 -> {m = 0 /\ n = 1} + {m = 1 /\ n = 0}
Fin.of_nat_lt = fix of_nat_lt (p n : nat) {struct p} : p < n -> Fin.t n := match n as n0 return (p < n0 -> Fin.t n0) with | 0 => fun H : p < 0 => False_rect (Fin.t 0) (Nat.nlt_0_r p H) | S n' => match p as p0 return (p0 < S n' -> Fin.t (S n')) with | 0 => fun _ : 0 < S n' => Fin.F1 | S p' => fun H : S p' < S n' => Fin.FS (of_nat_lt p' n' (lt_S_n p' n' H)) end end : forall p n : nat, p < n -> Fin.t n Arguments Fin.of_nat_lt {p n}%nat_scope
BinIntDef.Z.to_nat = fun z : Z => match z with | Z.pos p => Pos.to_nat p | _ => 0 end : Z -> nat Arguments BinIntDef.Z.to_nat _%Z_scope
non_div_1 : forall a : nat, a <> 1 -> ~ divides 1 a
fast_Zplus_assoc_reverse : forall (n m p : Z) (P : Z -> Prop), P (n + (m + p))%Z -> P (n + m + p)%Z
fast_Zplus_assoc : forall (n m p : Z) (P : Z -> Prop), P (n + m + p)%Z -> P (n + (m + p))%Z
dec_impl_lt_dec : forall P : nat -> Prop, (forall n : nat, {P n} + {~ P n}) -> forall m : nat, {n : nat | n < m /\ P n} + {forall n : nat, n < m -> ~ P n}
power_rel_prime : forall d a n : nat, n > 0 -> rel_prime a (power d n) -> rel_prime a d
euclide : forall a b : nat, b <> 0 -> {q : nat & {r : nat | a = b * q + r /\ r < b}}
Fin.to_nat = fix to_nat (m : nat) (n : Fin.t m) {struct n} : {i : nat | i < m} := match n in (Fin.t n0) return {i : nat | i < n0} with | @Fin.F1 j => exist (fun i : nat => i < S j) 0 (Nat.lt_0_succ j) | @Fin.FS n0 p => let (i, P) := to_nat n0 p in exist (fun i0 : nat => i0 < S n0) (S i) (lt_n_S i n0 P) end : forall m : nat, Fin.t m -> {i : nat | i < m} Arguments Fin.to_nat {m}%nat_scope
divides_le : forall a b : nat, a <> 0 -> divides a b -> b <= a
remainder_euclide : nat -> forall b : nat, b <> 0 -> nat
quotient_euclide : nat -> forall b : nat, b <> 0 -> nat

```  
intros n p H1 H2.
destruct H1 as [H1a H1b].
destruct (not_prime_impl_prime_divides p H1a) as [H3 | H3].
- exists 1. split.
  + apply divides_nat with (n := p).
    * exists p. split; auto.
    * intros contra. unfold not in H3.
      destruct contra as [p' [H4 H5]].
      apply H3; auto.
  + intros contra. apply H2.
    * intros H6. apply H3. right; auto.
    * rewrite contra in H2. discriminate.
- destruct H3 as [q [H4 H5]].
  destruct (euclide n p H4 H2) as [q' [r [H6 H7]]].
  exists q'. split.
  + apply divides_nat with (n := p).
    * exists q. rewrite H6, Nat.mul_add_distr_r; auto.
    * intros contra. apply H3.
      exists q'. split; auto.
  + intros contra. apply H7. rewrite contra, H5; auto.
```

original: intros n p H1 H2. destruct H1 as [H1a H1b]. destruct (not_prime_impl_prime_divides p H1a) as [H3 | H3]. - exists 1. split. + apply divides_nat with (n := p). * exists p. split; auto. * intros contra. unfold not in H3. destruct contra as [p' [H4 H5]]. apply H3; auto. + intros contra. apply H2. * intros H6. apply H3. right; auto. * rewrite contra in H2. discriminate. - destruct H3 as [q [H4 H5]]. destruct (euclide n p H4 H2) as [q' [r [H6 H7]]]. exists q'. split. + apply divides_nat with (n := p). * exists q. rewrite H6, Nat.mul_add_distr_r; auto. * intros contra. apply H3. exists q'. split; auto. + intros contra. apply H7. rewrite contra, H5; auto.
